description: Test your knowledge about summer activities, weather, and traditions

questions.question: What causes a mirage on a hot summer day?
questions.funFact: The word 'mirage' comes from the Latin 'mirare', meaning 'to look at' or 'to wonder at'!
questions.story: A mirage occurs when light rays bend due to layers of air at different temperatures. On hot days, the air near the ground is warmer than the air above it, causing light to bend upward. This creates the illusion of water on the road, which is actually a reflection of the sky.

questions.question: Which summer Olympic Games were the first to be broadcast on television?
questions.funFact: The 1936 Olympics were broadcast to special viewing rooms around Berlin, reaching about 162,000 viewers!
questions.story: The 1936 Berlin Olympics marked many firsts, including the first torch relay and the first televised sports event. The German Post Office transmitted 72 hours of live Olympic coverage to viewing halls in Berlin and Potsdam using a then-revolutionary electronic system.

questions.question: What is the summer solstice?
questions.funFact: In the Arctic Circle, the sun doesn't set at all on the summer solstice!
questions.story: The summer solstice occurs when Earth's axis is most tilted toward the sun, resulting in the longest day of the year in the Northern Hemisphere. Ancient civilizations celebrated this day with festivals and rituals, many of which continue today in various forms.
